events.description: End of the most recent Ice Age.
The Altamira Cave paintings
events.details: A bison on the ceiling of the Altamira Cave.

events.description: Humans are eating lentils, vetch and pistachios.
Humans are cultivating rye.
Founding of a permanent settlement.

events.location: Levant (Syria, Israel, Palestine, Lebanon, Jordan, Cyprus, Turkey)
events.description: Cultivation of emmer and einkorn wheat, barley, peas, lentils, bitter vetch, chickpeas, and flax.
Construction of a temple-shrine.
events.details: The excavation site at Göbekli Tepe.

events.description: The settlement now consists of 70 dwellings, a stone wall, and a tower.
events.details: A view of the remains of the earliest wall/tower at Jericho.

events.description: Farmers build a permanent agrarian settlement with mud-brick buildings for agricultural storage.
Oldest surviving wooden bows.
events.details: A German bow used by the Holmegaard culture that dates to 9000 BCE.

events.description: Domestication of sheep in several locations in central and southwest Asia.
A permanent settlement begins.
First evidence of metalworking with a copper pendant.
Agriculture is well-established along the banks of the Nile.
Domestication of goats.
Domestication of pigs in the Near East, China, and Germany.
Domestication of squash.
Domestication of cats.
Agriculture is well-established.
Dwellers have domesticated emmer wheat, barley, sheep, and goats.

events.details: A view of the archaeological excavations at Çatalhöyük. Woven linen cloth is being made.

events.description: Domestication of cattle in North Africa, India, and Mesopotamia.
Agriculture using irrigation begins.
A fortified settlement is established.
Earliest evidence of winemaking.
Domestication of chickens in India and Southeast Asia.
Domestication of llamas.
The Seated Woman of Çatal Hüyük figurine is made.
events.details: The head and right arm rest are restorations.

events.description: First evidence of sailing boats.
First evidence of copper smelting.
A permanent settlement is founded.

events.location: Mesopotamia and the Indus Valley (Iraq; Pakistan)
events.description: Invention of the ard plow.
Oldest traces of beer brewing.
Oldest evidence of rowing oars.
Domestication of maize.
Woven flax cloth is made.
Rice and sorghum are domesticated.
The Sitting Woman and Thinker of Cernavoda figurines are made by the Hamangia culture.
events.details: The Thinker of Cernavoda (left) and Woman of Hamangia.

events.description: First evidence of bronze making, using copper and tin.
Invention of the two-beamed horizontal loom.
The first wheeled vehicles appear in Mesopotamia, the Indus Valley, and the Northern Caucasus.
Domestication of the horse.
The Sumerians found the city of Ur.
events.details: The ruins of the City of Ur.

events.description: The earliest date in the Jewish calendar, representing the year before the creation of the world (Anno Mundi).
First evidence of agricultural field systems and stone walls.
The Minoan culture begins.

events.location: Mesopotamia and the Indus Valley (Iraq; Pakistan)
events.description: The potter’s wheel is invented.
Glassmaking begins in Mesopotamia and Egypt.
The first forged bronze nails.
The Bronze Age begins in the Near East.
Neolithic farmers construct the Newgrange monument with stone tools.
The first writing systems appear in Mesopotamia (cuneiform), Egypt (hieroglyphics), and the Indus Valley (Indus Script).
events.details: An inscription on a clay tablet written in the archaic cuneiform script and dating to c. 26th Century BCE.

events.description: Menes or Narmer (possibly the same person) unites Upper and Lower Egypt.
First evidence of ox-drawn plows.
Smelting of iron ore to make wrought iron begins in the Middle East.
The Jomon culture begins making flame-style ceramic vessels.
events.details: A flame-style vessel made by the Jomon culture in about 2500 BCE.

events.description: The Old Kingdom begins.
The Sumerians invent the first abacus counting machine.
The Indus Valley culture is using seals carved with pictographic symbols in commercial transactions.
events.details: Seals found at the Indus Valley city of Mohenjo-Daro.
